1 Text: What order should you read Clausewitz's On War?
2 Text: Book VIII first (War Plans), then Book I Chapter 1 (What is War?), then Book I Chapters 3 and 7. This is National War College pedagogy.
Violence/passion (the people), chance/probability (the military), reason/policy (the government). War must balance all three.
Absolute: pure theoretical concept of unlimited violence. Real: actual war, always modified by politics and friction. War is never autonomous.
'...policy by other means.' War always serves political purpose.
'The force that makes the apparently easy so difficult.' Explains why simple plans fail. Grounds all planning in humility.
Uncertainty pervading all information in war. Commanders must act on incomplete, often wrong information.
Moment when offensive power no longer exceeds defense. Attacker must either achieve objectives or go on defense.
